definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: People used to give credit Columbus for the discovery of the New Continent.
sentences.chinese: 人們過去把發現新大陸的功勞歸之於哥倫布。

sentences.english: The larvae feed on the tender leaves and cause injury to Mahonia leveileana shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 幼蟲取食嫩葉，對闊葉十大功勞造成嚴重損害。

sentences.english: You can accomplish much if you do not care who gels the credit.
sentences.chinese: 一個人假如不計較功勞歸屬於誰，他的成就就會更大。

sentences.english: Fire is good merchandise, credit is a collective, once pressed the library, pay out compensation.
sentences.chinese: 火了是好貨，功勞屬集體，一旦壓了庫，工資往外賠。

sentences.english: Ennoble a prime minister for distinguished service.
sentences.chinese: 因其傑出的功勞授予總理爵位。

sentences.english: Years before, Van Buren had done much himself to elect Jackson to the White House.
sentences.chinese: 幾年前，範布倫爲傑克遜入主白宮立下了汗馬功勞。

sentences.english: He always take the credit work we've done together.
sentences.chinese: 他總是把我們共同工作的功勞佔爲已有。

sentences.english: Gamla this. i said it was all pengs uncle.
sentences.chinese: 格拉莞說那都是蓬勒叔叔的功勞。

sentences.english: We did all the work and she gets all the credit.
sentences.chinese: 工作是我們乾的，而功勞卻歸了她。

sentences.english: He always takes credit for the work we've done together.
sentences.chinese: 他總是把我們共同工作的功勞佔爲己有。

sentences.english: In the end, profanity does have its place, except if you say it too much, they will just become annoying.
sentences.chinese: 忌語其實還是有它的功勞的，但講太多就不好了。

sentences.english: He has distinguished himself many times at the risk of life since he joined the army.
sentences.chinese: 他參軍以來，出生入死屢建功勞。

sentences.english: Find and scent, my compadres and you too, shall have much rewarding from the master.
sentences.chinese: 同志們，找到氣味，主人不會忘記我們的汗馬功勞。

sentences.english: Of rubbish mail put in, also be the contribution of baleful software.
sentences.chinese: 垃圾郵件的投放，也是惡意軟件的功勞。

sentences.english: Shanghaimakes it harder for Hong Kong to continue resting on its laurels.
sentences.chinese: 上海使香港不能再躺在自己的功勞簿上休息。

definition: to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on
to surpass others/outstanding/(basketball, soccer etc) to get past an opponent
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
to think (i.e. to take it to be true that ...) (Usually there is an implication that the notion is mistaken – except when expressing one's own current opinion.)
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to sacrifice one's life/to sacrifice (sth valued)/beast slaughtered as a sacrifice
